reviews.review_msg: Just like BUS 814, BUS 818 is too theoretical and not practical at all. Avi is a nice person (like a grandfather) but someone else should teach these two courses. I was disappointed in them because I didn't find them overly useful for my career goals.
Lectures prepared extremely well. Grades on average are a bit higher that people deserve. Always willing to help. Overall, he is such a nice fella.

Avi is one of the best professors I have ever had throughout my seven years study at SFU.(Both at undergrad and graduate level).The notes are well written and made the material much clear than any existing textbooks (Hull, McDonald, Jarrow Turnbull). The notes are also clear enough substitute attendance of lecture. Exams are fair for those practice

Avi is what other profs should strive to be. he responds to emails promptly, has excellent lecture notes, corrects the typos in his notes as soon as they are discovered (and then he lets u know on the website exactly where the corrections were made). he is interesting, explains things clearly, and overall is a very pleasant and humble human being.
